Chapter 17 

     11 (Matthew 26:28; Hebrews 9:22). Blood Was Sacred.--The blood of the Son of God was symbolized by the blood of the slain victim, and God would have clear and definite ideas preserved between the sacred and the common. Blood was sacred, inasmuch as through the shedding of the blood of the Son of God alone could there be atonement for sin (ST July 15, 1880).
